Sunday, June 24, 2007 - 9:45 am Essex River Basin Adventures . Let's get together for a 3 hour kayaking tour. It's perfect for beginners as well as intermediate paddlers. I need to make reservations fairly soon so please try to rsvp as early as possible. This tour comes highly recommended by our very own "John".

SEA KAYAKING ON THE NORTH SHORE OF COASTAL MASSACHUSETTS, ESSEX, ESSEX, MA, KAYAK, SEA KAYAKING, KAYAKING, ESTUARIES, HOG ISLAND, CHOATE ISLAND, CRANES BEACH, CLAM BAKE, LOBSTER BAKE, CORPORATE OUTINGS, THULE, PERCEPTION, KAYAKS, EDDYLINE KAYAKS, WILDERNESS SYSTEMS, WERNER PADDLES, NORTH SHORE.
EXPLORE the pristine beauty of the tidal estuaries or the Essex River in a sea kayak. We are a quality outfitter offering guided sea kayak tours along the tidal estuaries of the Essex River. No experience is needed. We cater to the novice and intermediate paddlers. We also offer longer trips to other destinations for the more experienced kayaker, as well as instructional clinics and private training for all levels.

ENJOY the serenity of paddling along thousands of acres of protected marshland. Climb to the top of Hog Island for a spectacular view of the Essex River and Ipswich Bay. Stop for a swim at Crane's Beach, one of the world's finest barrier beaches. Or head off to Thatcher Island, Plum Island or other offshore islands for a longer adventure with our experienced guide staff.

DISCOVER the enjoyment of spotting an osprey, heron, or egret from your kayak. Experience the freedom, fun, and physical exercise of sea kayaking. Our kayaks are stable and responsive, and are steered by a foot-controlled rudder system. Our guides are knowledgeable and friendly and want to make sure that you have a good time. People of all ages and abilities can enjoy this sport. One trip, and you'll understand why sea kayaking is growing in popularity so rapidly.
Essex River Basin Adventures
One Main Street
Essex, MA 01929
978/768-ERBA (3722)

Introductory Gilligan Tour (3 Hours)

A tour of the scenic estuaries of the Essex River Basin. Perfect for the beginner or intermediate paddler. Our most popular tour!
52.00 per person . *please arrive at least 45 min prior to departure
What you need to bring and wear
Summer: Bathing suit or shorts, T-shirt and a light cover-up.
Spring & Fall: Avoid jeans or sweatshirts, polar fleece works well.
Watersocks or an old pair of sneakers. Your feet will get wet!

Suntan lotion, a hat, sunglasses attached to a strap, insect spray. Drinking water and a snack. Change of clothes.

Rentals of dry bags spray shirts, farmer johns, water socks and most anything that you would need is available at our store.
